item.title: Energy Development Program Implementation Act of 2009

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S9438-9439)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9437-9438)

summary.text:
Directs the Secretary of Energy to develop and implement strategic plans for the energy development program consistent with title V of the Nuclear Nonproliferation Act of 1978.

Requires the Secretary to report to the appropriate congressional committees respecting: (1) such plans; and (2) expanding specified cooperative activities into an international cooperative effort which shall include an analysis of an Alternative Energy Corps to encourage technically trained volunteers to live and work in developing countries.

bill.title: Energy Development Program Implementation Act of 2009

item.title: Energy Development Program Implementation Act of 2009

A bill to implement title V of the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Act of 1978 and to promote economical and environmentally sustainable means of meeting the energy demands of developing countries, and for other purposes.
Energy Development Program Implementation Act of 2009

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S9438-9439)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
